title: 115_s1286
content: The "Freedom to Export to Cuba Act of 2017" removes provisions restricting trade and other relations with Cuba. The text discusses amendments to the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 and the Cuban Democracy Act of 1992 regarding embargoes on Cuba. It also mentions the authorities conferred upon the President by the Trading With the Enemy Act with respect to Cuba. The text discusses the removal of direct trade restrictions on Cuba imposed by regulations in effect before the enactment of the Act. Any export prohibitions to Cuba under the Export Administration Act of 1979 will also be lifted. The Act removes trade restrictions on Cuba and allows the President to impose export controls under the Export Administration Act of 1979 or the International Emergency Economic Powers Act in case of a national emergency. The Cuban Democracy Act of 1992 is amended by removing certain sections and making conforming amendments to the Cuban Liberty and Democratic Solidarity Act. The Cuban Liberty and Democratic Solidarity Act of 1996 is amended by removing sections and making conforming amendments. The Trade Sanctions Reform and Export Enhancement Act of 2000 is amended to remove references to Cuba and make changes to certain subsections. The Trade Sanctions Reform and Export Enhancement Act of 2000 is amended by redesignating paragraphs and subsections, moving them to the left, and making changes to references to Cuba. Section 909 (22 U.S.C. 7208) is also struck.
